Every turn in combat makes you more exhausted. More the effect accumulates more severe consequences it causes, until death.
Twice a day Short Rest weakens the effect, Long Rest removes it completely.

Exhaustion levels: 16 - Slight Fatigue, 24 - Sleep Deprivation, 40 - Death.
This creature will die at the end of its turn.
This creature should pass constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">saving throw</LSTag> DC [1] every turn or fall asleep.

This creature fought for a long time and exhausted its strength. It takes [1] penalty on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SkillCheck">Skill Checks</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and spell <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Difficulty Class</LSTag>.
This creature has successfully passed constitution check and became temporarily immune to effects of sleep deprivation.

Twice a day, you can restore 50% of your <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>. Warlocks restore their <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag>. Twice a day also reduces Exhaustion by 10 plus half of your character level, rounded down.

Drink to fall into a 2-turn slumber. Unless interrupted, you gain the benefits of a Short Rest and regain all 1st and 2nd Level spell slots. Reduces Exhaustion by 10 plus half of your character level, rounded down.

If you are awoken before the duration expires, the effects will not apply.

Drink to fall into a 2-turn slumber. Unless interrupted, you gain the benefits of a Long Rest. Removes Exhaustion effects completely.

If you are awoken before the duration expires, the effects will not apply.

Do you want to end the day?

You don't have enough camp supplies. Taking a Long Rest now will only restore 10% of your hit points and reset most of the spell and item cooldowns.
Your hit points will be restored up to 10% of their maximum, and you will reset most of the spell and item cooldowns.

You will not use any <LSTag Tooltip="CampSupplies">camp supplies</LSTag>, but your <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> will only be restored up to 10% of their maximum, and you will reset most of the spell and item cooldowns. You won't regain any <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rests</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> or any other resources.

Go to camp and end the day.

You can use camp supplies to regain hit points, spell slots, Short Rests, and completely remove Exhaustion.
